page.title: 08Linton Hospital
page.content:
Linton Hospital was originally built as the local workhouse in 1776. At present the hospital consists of three parts: 8 wards for geriatric patients, a day hospital for elderly patients who visit the hospital during the daytime only and Twyford House which is a unit for physically handicapped patients. The whole hospital has 222 beds and approximately 400 staff.
The hospital is forecasted to close over the coming year or so with 2 wards transferring to the Maidstone Hospital in November 1985, 2 wards to Preston Hall in March 1986 and the remainder in late 1986. The ambulance control for the whole of Kent is due to be centralised at Linton Hospital in the future.
